laboratory_examinations.findings: The liver is normal in size, echogenicity and architecture. The gallbladder is mildly distended, contains mobile shadowing gallstones, and has mild gallbladder wall edema. There is no intra- or extra-hepatic biliary dilatation, the common duct measures 5 mm, and there is normal hepatopetal flow in the main portal vein. There is no perihepatic ascites.
